project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It should be Possible, that attachments with the same file name are shown as Versions. The Idea is, that when you upload a new attachment with same name as an attachment which is already existing at this object, the link of the attachment works as dropdown (like the functionality in the Smart Attachments Plugin in Jira).I Think this is a little change in programming, but a big change in functionality, because (with some user-rights added to the delete-Button) you'll have a Version safe DMS. :)
fields.summary: Attachment Versioning

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have Insight Objects whiche are linked to users in JIRA and we would like to send an Email to the User with Informations out of Insight. What we can do in the moment is to do a Catalog Report where we can see the User but not the Mail. It would be nice to get this information as well when we export it with a level of two or more like it is now we linked Insight objects.
fields.summary: Report Export User Inforamtion

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,we use Insight for tracking every asset assigned to a user, and then we label it with a name and a QR-CODE directly from insight.We need to be able to print circular label: obviously not the text, but the form-factor. Like a badge.Related to this is the neccesity to print without the black border box, and also could be usefull being able to print vertical text.Thank you for your attention,  Regards    Massimiliano
fields.summary: Print circular label

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,  I would love to see some improvements to the label printing capabilities in insight.  # Possibility to disable the borders around the label - At the moment i have not found reasonable solution to position the content in the printed label in way that it would look professional whit the label. The content inside the borders looks good, but the borders makes the whole label look bit cheap, and gives out impression that the label should've been cut to shape around the border.  # This might bee overkill - but instead of defining the label area in pixels, we could define the actual label size. Now when i'm making label i constantly need to adjust the template size, preview, adjust, test print, adjust....  Thanks
fields.summary: Improved label printing

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have the use case that Jenkins generates pre-processed CSV files that should be imported by Insight and triggers the import by calling /import/start/<id>.The URL to the CSV files contain the build number thus are not static as currently required by the import configuration.Currently I use a workaround that uses static URLs that point to the last successful build but that is not guaranteed to be the last build causing old data to be imported or failing the import completely.It would be great, if the REST API call to /import/start/<id> would allow to pass/override some of the configuration parameters (esp. the CSV url) to make the import more flexible.
fields.summary: Add parameterization to the REST API call /import/start/<id> (esp. CSV url)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The UI of Insight in certain areas behaves differently compared to the JIRA UI which is annoying and slows down productivity.Here are my observations: * Support for (consistent) keyboard shortcuts is missing (esp. 'e' for 'Edit' or 'j'/'k' for navigating in lists) - press '?' in JIRA to see all shortcuts or see for example [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/4-ways-get-jira-keyboard-shortcuts] * Hyperlinks in buttons and menus seem to be simulated using JavaScript thus right-click and open in new tab does not work (it does so in JIRA though)
fields.summary: UX improvements and consistency with JIRA (esp. shortcuts, hyperlinks)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently the possibilities of Insight are limited because the flexible IQL filters cannot be stored and re-used.This is what I'd expect to work: * Provide links to stored filters that query certain objects * Use filters as the basis for reports * Use filters as the basis for gadgets in Confluence and JIRA
fields.summary: Support for re-usable filters

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Our customer (we're Riada Partner) uses Insight and wants to get Insight fields to be populated automatically when only one object is found (eg. automatically set user's laptop when the user has only one laptop assigned).Same for referenced fields (when selecting master field makes only one possible choice for referenced field).
fields.summary: Automatic default value for Insight field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When the Ultimate Theming plugin is installed, all Insight fields don't send all custom fields on a Jira Service Desk form to Insight REST endpoints. This means that if there's any Issue Scope IQL, these won't return any values and the Insight custom fields don't work.I raised this with the Ultimate Theming vendor and they have put in a workaround. However to quote them:"Yes, instead of being specific on which form to get the values from, they assume that the first form on the page is the Service Desk form. That might be true for a standard installation, but does not apply if the company (you) has installed add-ons (mine or others)."Any selector (jquery) should be as specific as possible."Can you please update your Insight custom fields to look at all forms on a Jira Service Desk page?Insight SEN-12203484
fields.summary: Insight fields with Issue Scope IQL don't work when other JSD plugins are installed

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently in Insight, there does not seem to be a way to grant users the ability to create new objects and modify existing ones, but not also be able to apply changes to all objects at once using the "Bulk Action" This is preventing us from implementing a wider access to our CMDB for lower level techs to maintain their records.
fields.summary: Not able to Restrict "Bulk Action" permissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Our client has brought up the point that as they are rolling out Insight to production, how will they monitor the jobs ongoing? It seems ideal if there can be an email sent out if a job fails. Or perhaps an email can be sent whenever a job finishes or is cancelled, with whatever result? That will be much more practical for them to use long term.
fields.summary: Automated failure notifications for import jobs?

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Some objects have too many attributes and it takes long time to complete Object type mapping of Import configuration for each object. As some object attributes are similar to another object attributes it would be very helpful if Import  (CSV, User, etc.) configuration including Object type mapping configuration can be copied to create a new one without adding all those fields/ attributes manually again.
fields.summary: Feature to copy Import configuration to create a new one

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: More friendly to Chinese Windows users
fields.summary: Encoding support ANSI in Export

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: HiLet's take an example. One object type 'location', one object type 'computer'. There is a object reference between both. While there are many changes for the computer object type (especially newly buyed), there are only just a few for locations."Enable quick creation of referenced objects" is a global attribute for the whole schema. But we like to configure this as a per object type settings, so quick creation for computers is possible, but not for locations. So every object types attribute setting should have a "quick creation" option. The global setting should work a default setting for every newly created object type, but after the object type is created, the "quick creation" setting for this object type should be possible to enable/disable. This way it would be possible to define for which object types quick creation is possible and for which not.Kind regardsBerthold
fields.summary: Restrict quick creation to specific object types

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,Insight Importers synchronization are scheduled or manually launched ... To make it work in automated larger processes of data management, it would be nice to have a way to condition the start of the synchronization :- The Importer should be able to check the content of "cookie" file (maybe using a RegExp) where a previous (external) process have left a "status" that says if all is ok or not and that the whole process should continue or not ...AND/OR- The Importer should be able expose a REST endpoint that could be called by another tool the launch the synchronization... - The Importer should be able to write in a db or external text file the status of the synchronization for next process (if exist)What do you think about it ?Regards,Pierre-Jean Constant.
fields.summary: Add a way to launch synchronization with Insight Importers in a conditional way

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: To get a overview about used attributes, we suggest to create a new place where all attributes from a schema is globally listed. This site could placed for example in new tab in object schema configuration. See mockup... !image-2018-09-07-14-44-15-222.png|thumbnail! (Creation date and Created by should be meta information for every attribute)
fields.summary: Attribute overview list

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: On an installation with a large amount of objects the initial start time for Insight can be some minutes. Look into decreasing the amount of time the Insight Launcher uses for data integrity checks on startup.
fields.summary: Decrease the startup time needed for Insight

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The known issues page that mentions the problems with request types getting messed up if Insight is disabled while someone accesses a JSD form should probably mention that it is not only a bad idea to upgrade Insight while users access JSD, but also to update UPM as UPM disables and enables all plugins. For instance, add the following:"Note that UPM (the Universal Plugin Manager) disables and then re-enables all plugins when it is updated. This means that Insight will be disabled for a short period of time when UPM is updated and that this could very well lead to the same loss of Insight fields in the Service Desk forms."I am referring to this page:https://documentation.riada.se/display/ICV56/Know+issues+with+Jira+Service+Desk
fields.summary: Insight Documentation on known issues w JSD should mention that UPM should not be upgraded

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We were wondering if it's possible to include if statements or any other conditional clauses into Insight Query Language. The reason we would need this functionality is that we have two object types the first called Devices and the second one called Device models, which are linked to each other. Each Device has a unique serial and each Device model has a unique name. In our SD we have corresponding custom fields. In normal circumstances we select the device serial and the device model is auto assigned. But if the the device serial isn't known, we would like to firstly determine the device model so that we filter out the possible serials. We had tried to achieve this with the filter scope (IQL) setting in the Insight custom field settings, but were unsuccessful, we even tried using Behaviors to script the custom fields, but have found out that Behaviors are not compatible with Insight custom filed types. Do you maybe have a solution we could use?
fields.summary: If statements into Insight Query Language

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey guys, one thing we noticed - when you delete objects in bulk from the UI, there is no progress bar or indication so there is no way for the executor to know what is going on and is the delete still in progress.Perhaps you should add it to the list of features which need to be added.
fields.summary: Add progress bar on bulk deletion of objects from the UI

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In old versions of Insight it was possible to fetch objects during reindex.During the reindex this was shown:""Insight are in reindex mode (11% Complete). Fetching objects may be slower than usual"." In recent versions of Insight (5.0+?) it seems like its not possible to fetch objects at all during reindex. So in Insight Custom fields no values are shown and when running IQLs result sets are empty. We would like to get the old feature back where its possible to have slow fetch of objects during reindex. As it is now we need to disabled all integrations and all users in order to reindex insight.
fields.summary: Fetching objects during Insight reindex

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In order to be able to Configure an Insight customfield through APIs, without relying on the UI.Currently, using JIRA APIs a CF can be created and assigned to screens, but cannot be configured (IQL Filter Scopes, Visibility and Search on Attributes etc)
fields.summary: Public Resource to configure an Insight Customfield

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The import of JIRA users should be a 2-way synchronisation.If an Insight object of type "contact" is created then a JSD customer should be created with a specific jira-group.||Object Attribute||JIRA User Field|||Name|Name||Email|Email||Email or Username|Username||property 1|user properties|
fields.summary: Create JIRA Service Desk User

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As an easier approach than the current. We can allow the user to upload any attachment even if the object did not have any. This can be done through adding the attachment button in the object overview window
fields.summary: UI - Add the attach button to the object overview window at all times

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: IQL placeholders can only act on Issue data, not on specific Jira Service Desk implementations sunc as (and in this case) the default values on hidden fields. This feature should add a way of using JSD default values as placeholders when filtering objects.
fields.summary: Improve Insight custom fields for JSD

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Java APIs for the automations would be nice, also REST API I believe is missing? I´d like to be able to list, check last runtime/result, trigger the automations and see if its currently running. Creating/editing automations via API would be a nice to have, but not anything I need at the moment.
fields.summary: Expose Automation APIs

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Today all assets that are related to a ticket are shown as a square which make it impossible to get a good overview when you relate a lot of assets to a ticket. We would like this visualization in the custom field to be more like the "List View" that can be found within Insight. I have attached two pictures, one on how it looks today and one on how we would like it to be presented instead.
fields.summary: Better visualization of the attributes in a Jira ticket

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I'm writing an IQL query to match an attribute value against another, but it fails because what happens is that I end up comparing an attribute value to a text value instead of another attribute value because placeholders are not supported in IQL statements. For example: <= (IF "Available Stock" <= ${stock alert threshold} THEN Send email alert).
fields.summary: Support placeholders to replace the value of an attribute in Automation IQL statements.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In Jira we have a project that contains issue type "Feature". Feature has several attributes of type Insight Object/s ("Customer Obs", "Teams", "Feature Type", "Feature Size" and "It Product").In Confluence we use standard Jira Issues Macro (https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-issues-macro-139380.html) to display a list of tickets. If the display contains Insight fields, they are rendered in the format *Label (Key)*. As you can see in the attached screenshot inclusion of key makes the list rather unreadable.Displaying only Label would be much better. Somehow this seems to be possible with other custom fields (i.e. nFeed).P.S. - This ticket was raised by request from: https://portal.riada.io/plugins/servlet/desk/portal/12/RPS-8132
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro in Confluence showing Label + Key

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The end user experience could be highly improved by only providing a search that corresponds to a common value selection.  The current search panel (when clicking near the field) is the one for the administrators (users who configure and understand Insight and its logic). The end user should not have the same view: it won't understand. The solution to this is to provide a tree selection with all related objects: - List of the first level choice of objects (and not object types: users don't need to see that)- When clicking on object: shows dependent children objects.
fields.summary: Object Search Functionality for end users

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be really nice to have the option to have the tree view available not only when looking at the object graph but also when viewing the object type graphs. Today it is not possible to see the tree structure. Also, what would be of great value is to replace the [Graph] button functionality with the [Object Graph] functionality so that we have the ability to visualize the Attribute Tree structure in addition to the floating bubbles view.Thanks
fields.summary: Tree view in Object Type Graph

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Dear sir or madam,we are evaluating Insight.There are problems reading from LDAP i.e. the field "objectSID" from Active Directory to insight.It's saved as bytestring in active directory, but insight doesn't read the LDAP-Scheme to save as string.So you will have invalid characters in the field.Same is if you are using ObjectID from active directory.In some company this is the unique identifier, because CN can change an primary key is lost.
fields.summary: Attribute - Add support for Hexadecimal and Binary fields as datatypes for object attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Use case : client is using Insight with different other integrations. For that they use Jira filters. The filters can be adapted all the time according to usability. What is needed is to enable one custom field to have different configs across multiple projects. In order to use the same placeholder of that CF on the filters
fields.summary: Custom fields - ability to use one custom field with different configs x different projects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We often see the need to prepopulate a field with an object based on placeholders, so that when a customer in JSD has populated a couple of other fields we can use IQLs and placeholders to determine what objects should be available in another field AND set one to be prepopulated in that field.  The UC I´m struggling right now is that we have "Jira Project"-objects with a referenced object attribute. When the user in JSD portal has selected a project he/she is admin of and now I want to display the referenced object in another field but give the user the ability to select another.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to sett default values for custom fields with placeholders

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Customers are asking for integrations with network monitoring solutions. Suggestions include * Solarwinds * Nagios (core or XI) * Datadog * Zabbix
fields.summary: Create Integration with one or more

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Our company uses Airwatch to manage mobiles/tablets. We would like to import Airwatch asset information to Insight (server Jira)
fields.summary: Integration to Airwatch needed

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: There are problems reading from LDAP i.e. the field "objectSID" from Active Directory to insight.It's saved as bytestring in active directory, but insight doesn't read the LDAP-Scheme to save as string.So you will have invalid characters in the field. This will be handled in Insight.
fields.summary: AD/LDAP import - Add the ability for objectSID to be added as an attribute in a readable format

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi, It would be a neat feature to create Confluence page directly from Insight object create/edit screen. Similarly to "Create New Object" functionality (attached). !image-2019-01-17-12-52-36-234.png!
fields.summary: Create Confluence page directly from Insight object create/edit screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It looks like the current post function only allows updating a single attribute (attribute with cardinality set to 1).  With conditionals on each post function this is a lot of maintenance and extra processing that isn't necessary. Also, it seems just as likely that you'd need to update more than one attribute value as you would a for a single attribute.
fields.summary: Update multiple attributes from a single Insight post-function

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: System placeholders like ${baseUrl} would be super useful in the automation system. If you're setting up REST calls to your Jira system, you want to be able to use a placeholder so you don't have to manually update your rules when copying to a development system.
fields.summary: System placeholders for Insight Automation mechanism

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,when using the currentProject() function in a filter issue scope in an Insight custom field it is not possible to change that field using Jira's bulk edit feature.In that specific context the currentProject() returns no value and therefore no values are available for selection.In our use case we have a custom field "Kunde" (= client company) whose values are restricted by the project the issue is created in (see attached screenshots).I'm not sure if this can be considered as a bug, but as it is definitely an unexpected result for end users I would consider it as one.For reference I had already opened an issue on the customer portal: RPS-9079Greetings,Michael
fields.summary: Filter issue scope with currentProject() prevents bulk edit

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi!I'm Cristian from Tecnofor, last year we were Atlassian Partner of the year Rising Star EMEA (feels amazing telling it to everyone), and we also made an event in our office with Fredic Karbing.Right now we are working hard trying to implement your app in customers who need a CMDB, and some of them have already asked about the possibility to have in the graphic view a warning signal depending of the status of the object.For example: A service is not working. The agent goes to the graphic view and see that the host of the Service has a warning signal which means the status is Down, Maintenance or whatever.The feature would be to allow mapping status with signals (info, warning, critical... something like that) in the graphic view.Could you please tell if this feature looks interesting enough to be implemented?Thank you!
fields.summary: As a Insight User, I would like to see a warning sign/icon in the graphical view, based on object status

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. ProposalAdd a tree view of the object schema same way the current implementation of the object type tree when you view a schema works
fields.summary: Object schema view - add the ability to view the object schema in a tree view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In some cases , the Insight object tab panel is required to be hidden/removed from the kanban board. Currently there is no option to hide it (on) P.S : This also applies for Jira 7.x versions (Insight 6.x)
fields.summary: Kanban board - Option to hide / disable Insight object tab panel

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: *Scenario* # Edit workflow # Click on a transition and choose Post functions # Add post function # Choose to add a Insight Post-Function # Choose to add Assign Objects from an IQL query based on data from an issue. # The condition field only displays 3 rows of code*Expected results*The condition code field shall be resizable so that a user can make it larger to be able to see more of the code. It is annoying working with a script when you only see 3 rows.!image-2019-03-21-16-05-58-131.png!
fields.summary: Make the condition field in insight post functions resizable

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: This feature request is to add the number of records returned from an IQL query when searching within the Insight Interface within JIRA.  This functionality would prove extremely beneficial to those with large and diverse object libraries. In an example pertinent to our organization, we have several thousand workstations we are tracking within Insight.  We track the identity of if these are either Laptops, Desktops, MiniPCs, etc... using an attribute of the Workstation Object Type.  However, if I query to limit my returned workstations to just those that are laptops, I do not have a clear indication of how many are returned in this query.The image attached, represents this example.
fields.summary: Add Number of Records / Objects Returned from IQL Query in Insight Console

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When you have a complex hierarchy where certain fields apply only to a subset of children, you can't use inheritance (e.g. RAM only applies to certain IT equipment so it nees to be a sperate attribute on each child). When viewing (in list view) all children from the top level in the hierarchy, the columns with the same name are listed separately (once for each child that has that attribute). In my example of RAM, I get a separate RAM column for Mobile Phones, Laptops, Desktops, External HDD, Tablets, etc - this should all just show in a single column in the List View.This feature already works correctly in the Search functionality, so it would be good if this also worked the same in the List View.
fields.summary: Combine columns with same name in Object Type -> List View

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be very helpful to have Jira custom fields to display an attribute of an object (read-only).Some example benefits would be: # Users could more easily search for the values without knowing IQL # Values could be used in other functions/plugins, e.g. a mailaddesses attribute in an Email this Issue post-function # Groups and users could be used in permission schemes # Sorting by these values will be much easier # Displaying them in reports or dashboards doesn´t "destroy" the layoutWe´re hitting this need nearly in every project with Insight.
fields.summary: Read-Only Customs fields for attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We require a feature to allow batch deleting objects using API calls instead of deleting objects one by one.The current solution is to filter all the objects to be deleted, move them into a "temporary" objectType then run the following REST call on that objectType ID {noformat}/rest/insight/1.0/objecttype/{id}{noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to batch delete objects using REST

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing an specific object on the Overview screen, we would like to ability to hide/add certain attributes from being displayed. !https://eazybi.com/static/img/blog_page/posts/2018_06_18/IT-service-management-schema.png!
fields.summary: Ability to hide/display fields on the Object overview screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Since we updated to Insight Version > 7.0.0 the activity stream of Jira doesn't Show any activity updates relating Insight.As I already got informed by Riada Service by email, there was a security issue and therefore it was removed. Caused by the importance of this feature for us we would like to request that feature to be implemented again. A Downgrade of the Version isn't an Option for us so we hope to get it with a coming Version.
fields.summary: Activity Stream not updated anymore

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Add inbound references as column to an objecttypes table view.-> Optional: Ability to display all inbound references in a single column-> Must: Ability to choose the inbound referenced objects object type-> Optional: Ability to further filter on the displayed object using IQL
fields.summary: objects List view - ability to list all inR of an object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. Use caseLooking at insight objects using the table view, we can add several columns based on this object types attributes. We would like to not have this limited to an insight objects attributes, but to further use this column and add IQL in there.h2. Proposed SolutionThe IQL query that would be used in this place will then be able to contain a placeholder. This way, we can create a column that displays related objects, even thought there is no attribute on this specific object. This way we could create an IQL column, and have it displaying objects that have an outR towards the object I am currently watching.Optionally storing those columns and sharing them with colleagues would be benefitial as well. This way one would not have to create the same query over and over again.
fields.summary: In List view in the object schema view add the ability to apply IQL on attributes columns

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Trying to get the Object-SID from LDAP import gives "strange" numbers.!image-2019-06-12-16-55-45-842.png!After Import it looks like this in the user-object (configuration is default, text):!image-2019-06-12-16-56-09-583.png!output from powershell: {code:java}PS H:\> Get-ADUser -Identity oschalch -Properties objectSidobjectSid         : S-1-5-21-<censored>-<censored>-725345543-92017{code}btw. the SCCM importing this objectSid as well and it looks fine: !image-2019-06-12-17-01-28-845.png!
fields.summary: Importing object-SID from LDAP

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

As a user, it would be helpful to be able to save an IQL Filter, then use it to generate a Report.

This is currently available in the Object Search Report. However, the report should include specific Attributes, including Asset Cost, for example.

I would like to see each Asset's Cost (currently available) as well as the *total sum* of the whole column.

This exists in the Object Type View for attributes of the type Float / Integer, configured to "Show Sum"
fields.summary: Add a Total sum at the bottom of the Object Search Report

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I need a function with which I can automatically assign unique IDs for an object type in any field.Example: I have the object type "Computer" and the name of the objects is "PC-001", "PC-002". If I now add a new object this should automatically get the name "PC-003".The names are used as the DNS name. At the moment function is taken over again by our software for inventory. However, we want to realize everything about InSight.
fields.summary: Generate objectnames by scheme

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,I was trying to set up Insight to integrate with Statuspage.Statuspage works by receiving emails at a particular address - [https://help.statuspage.io/help/getting-started-with-email-automation]. These are formatted with a number of +'s.The issue is that in Insight Automation, users are not permitted to send emails to + addresses, despite this being perfectly legal.  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!Feature request to allow Insight Automation to send emails to external recipients with +'s in the email address.As an Insight administrator, I want an automation rule to automatically update my Statuspage whenever the status of an object changes, so I don't have to manually keep objects and incidents in Statuspage in sync.Cheers
fields.summary: Automation - Allow the email recipients engine to send emails to Status page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if a default view on the Objects screen can be created.Some fields like "Key" would not be relevant for most users to see in the list. !image-2019-06-28-12-26-28-525.png!
fields.summary: Default Object view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing a single object it would be great if attributes could be edited without having to click "Edit"!image-2019-06-28-12-29-21-632.png!
fields.summary: Quick edit on single object view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be useful to have a "Next" "Previous" record button to jump to the next/previous record and stay on the Edit screen.!image-2019-06-28-12-32-29-799.png!
fields.summary: "Next" / "Previous" button on Edit Object screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently there is no way to restrict which Jira users could be set into a "User" attribute. Two example use cases would be1) A user can only be used in one type of object (e.g. customer or supplier)2) Only users from a certain Jira user group (e.g. jira-software-users) should be entered in an objectWould be great to get this possibility, working with automation and setting an "to be checked" status for the object is a bit complicated ;)thanks for listening/readingThomas
fields.summary: Attribute Type "User" should have validator and/or filter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseAs business need allows the usage of read-only fields to auto populate some data on the customer tickets, the admin wishes for the customer to be able to view this info as well.h2. ProposalAdd the ability for read-only custom fields to be rendered on the portal same as regular fields !image-2019-07-10-11-34-44-989.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Make Read-only custom fields viewable on the customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently in Insight, the "created" value on each item in the /rest/insight/1.0/object/\{id}/history method, is returned in this format: 11/Jul/19 6:10 PM.This is quite limiting, as it makes it impossible to determine if two changes belong to one edit or two if they occurred in the same minute.  It would be really useful if this value was more specific, down to at least seconds.
fields.summary: Make the date value on the Object History REST API Endpoint more specific

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello!Insight automation rules are great the only problem about them is that they can't be triggered via postfuction (therefore cannot be intergrated in workflow).It would be great to have Insight postfunction that would trigger an insight automation rule.Please see for more information (here I dуscribe a bussiness case): * [https://portal.riada.io/plugins/servlet/desk/portal/12/RPS-11001]Thanks in advance looking forward to hear any news here.
fields.summary: Postfuction that would trigger an Insight autiomation rule

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Insight documentation lacks information on some methods that are on the javadocsFor instance, an example is needed to identify the correct usage of the methods described to fetch object history as explained [here|https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-5.3.1/com/riadalabs/jira/plugins/insight/services/model/ObjectHistoryBean.html].
fields.summary: Add more Groovy script examples to the documentation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: There is a need to translate customer facing elements of GUI to Polish.Please find screens attached showing minimum, great if all could be in Polish.
fields.summary: Polish translation, customer facing GUI

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the current version of Insight, it is no longer possible to create an object or project time report.Now you have to generate a custom report yourself.While there is an opportunity to do this through gadgets, these are not full reports.Not every company has the ability to create such a custom report itself.Please take over the reports for the new engine.
fields.summary: Ability to create Time Reports without Developer Skills

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the past we have used the Jira user attribute to populate our Teams objects so email post functions can email the members of the teams regarding new issues raised for their team. This list can easily get out of date, it would be much more useful to be able to add security groups so only AD and therefore Jira need to be kept up to date.
fields.summary: Ability to add security groups as attribute values instead of Jira users for use with email post functions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseIf the scheduling node dies in your DC, Insight is not optimised to look for another working node and set it as scheduling during that time.h2. PrognosisThe challenge is on what basis will Insight determine if the "alive" node is good enough for scheduling. If the scheduling node is set in the cluster to met certain requirements then other nodes might not be "powerful enough" to run scheduled tasks.h2. Desired scenarioInsight should be able to  # choose another scheduling node # inform the user that the scheduling node is off
fields.summary: Datacenter - If the scheduling node dies, Insight should choose another

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseA DC admin would like to setup bundle jobs, so that the user will be able to start/stop/suspend/resume/rerun in the bundle level resulting a better and easy operational control. Also preventing other jobs from running before the prior is completed.h2. PrognosisSetting up the scheduling in the import and automation jobs with no overview of which jobs are running at what time is not only cumbersome, but also not fail proof; since jobs sometimes can take much longer than anticipated if sources have changed a lot.h2. Desired scenarioProvide more control for bundled jobs to the admin and more clarity on their execution order
fields.summary: Datacenter - Allow the user to setup bundle jobs

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseUser wishes to manually trigger a rule (override WHEN clause)h2. PrognosisCurrently, there is no way to trigger a rule manually to override the WHEN clause. This would be a FR for manual trigger of specific rules (they can be hidden also to Insight permission users?)h2. Suggested solutionThe REST api is the best case scenario to allow a user to trigger a specific rule. We can add info that the trigger factor was via user X (log the rule trigger).Would also be cool if we added the WHEN clause to be another rule ;)
fields.summary: REST/Automation - Allow the user to send an API call to trigger an automation rule

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseUser wishes to manually trigger a rule (override WHEN clause)h2. PrognosisCurrently, there is no way to trigger a rule manually to override the WHEN clause. This would be a FR for manual trigger of specific rules (they can be hidden also to Insight permission users?)h2. Suggested solutionThe REST api is the best case scenario to allow a user to trigger a specific rule. We can add info that the trigger factor was via user X (log the rule trigger).Would also be cool if we added the WHEN clause to be another rule ;)
fields.summary: REST/Automation - Allow the user to send an API call to trigger an automation rule

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Add the possibility to auto-select by default a custom field value when there is only one electable option.
fields.summary: Default values

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. Use caseCurrently, the custom fields cannot be recycled and have to be used with the same configuration. This can be setup in a better way if we allowed the fields to be re-cycled or if the user could control the IQL config using groovy for example.h2. Feature requestAllow the user to control the cf configuration using scripting
fields.summary: Allow a user to control the custom field config using groovy/DB

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Search for Objects screen is very useful, however when the users is using IQL search the system is listing all the columns that are available in all objects type. It would be useful to have another dropdown to limit the list of columns for an object type similar to the one available in the columns screen.
fields.summary: Allow the users in Search for Objects to screen to choose which objects type to search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The current implementation of insight doesn't allow the admin to change the type of the attribute if it contains data. In some cases the users want to change the type from text to text area but the system doesn't allow that.
fields.summary: Allow the admin to change the attribute type even if contains data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: HiWe're currently in the process of getting our device and application assets into Insight.One thing one of our users would like to do is see the Tree view using the same functionality as the Force view where you can quickly and easily filter out based on reference type. I can see you can filter on attributes in the tree view but it doesnt seem to support filtering on IQL such as.object having inR("", "System Access")Would it not be better to have the same tick boxes in the tree view? Or is it not the intended use?
fields.summary: Tree view filtering by reference type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have a set of Object Referenced in an Object Attribute:Object:Name: BoxColor (referenced objects): Red, Yellow, GreenI want to import more information to this object (e.g. from CSV), adding the colors Blue and Pink to the already existing values.Currently (8.3.0) importing the CSV will overwrite the existing 3 Color Objects with the 2 new ones.I would like the import to result as:Name: BoxColor (referenced objects): Red, Yellow, Green, Blue, Pink(without requiring Additional attributes and Automation rules...)
fields.summary: Add an option in Import to append imported Objects to existing Objects in Referenced Attribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. Use caseI want to be able to update my user attribute which has cardinality unlimited as a maximum value. I have 400 users in that attribute. To remove one value, I have to send a list of 399 names instead of sending one name to be removed. This is due to the drawback of the PUT methodh2. ProposalAdd a DELETE/PATCH method in the REST API to allow performing this task more smoothly.
fields.summary: REST - Cannot update a single attribute value in a maxed cardinality attributeType

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When using the Automation Action to create a Jira Issue on a Service Desk Project;An Issue is created, however it is not getting the SLAs (possibly will "Corrupt" the Project).Indexing the Project or Updating the SLAs (in Project Configuration) will assign the SLAs correctly)Using the Jira Service Desk APIs in Automation Action: Http Request - works as expected.It will be nice to have the option to select Create JSD Ticket Action - and having the JSD Ticket created correctly.
fields.summary: Insight Automation - Create a Servicedesk Ticket

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi Insight Team,for a more or less complex Insight structure I'd need to verify related objects from several objectTypes in an attribute IQL-filter. So far, so good - unfortunately this IQL-filter is limited to 255 characters. It would be great for the future to have an increased amount of allowed characters, because 255 characters are only short IQLs in my environment ;)Many thanks in advance,Manuel
fields.summary: Increase the number of allowed characters in an attribute IQL filter (currently limited to 255 characters)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Now that ICS-1402 is resolved and IQL is supported in the new Catalog report, Customers would like to be able to use "ORDER BY" in the IQL, to arrange the root/first lavel Object Type in the Report.
fields.summary: Catalog Report IQL to support "ORDER BY <Attribute> DESC/ASC"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. Use caseThe current implementation will override any setup inheritance permissions on a child objectType if you add a specific permissions to it. Whilst this is a good feature but some users want to dynamically edit that and keep the inheritance and add modifications to it.h2. RequirementsAdd a button or config to allow permission inheritance to be inherited without over-riding the permissions if you simply want to edit the permission going down the chain in the inheritance tree
fields.summary: Inheritance - Add the ability to disable objectType permission to over-ride inherited parent objectType permissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Is there the intent to build out a connector for Okta to extract Employee related data?
fields.summary: Okta Integration for User Data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ability to access Jira field attributes within an object using placeholders

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We need an additional importer configuration which doesn't create new objects. Instead of this, a configuration is needed which only allows enriching existing objects.*Use case*I am currently working on an ITSM project involving JSD and Insight, of course We have two different user importers: A. Sourced from our user management (part of the ERP system) I import data (incl. phone numbers, managers, cost center assignments, locations, etc) from a SQL database. B. We import the Jira user directory in order to have the user group memberships which can be used for auto-assignments of IT services.Unfortunately, both data sources have a different amount of user. A. consists of 3500 users; B. has about 4200 users; Both sources combined means 4800 users in the CMDB. Obviously, both importers add users to system although only the amount of users from datasource A. is relevant for this use case. Having some irrelevant users in the CMDB is not a big deal at this moment. But I like to ask two questions:Importer B. runs before A. via scheduler. A. removes the missing objects from the CMDB. This will happen every night every day! One hour later the second importer will remove these users until we aligned both user sources. But at the end, there won't be a 100% match because the ITSM scope only impacts 90% of all Jira users.
fields.summary: Additional importer configuration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: URL / json imports currently timeout after 30 seconds, so there is no way to import large sets of json data without creating some kind of outside script to pull down those files ahead of time.If we're not worried about waiting, we should be able to set the timeout value so that we can just let the import run as long as it needs to.
fields.summary: Ability to adjust timeout for URL / json import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I created a print template to print informations from a asset on paper.It would be very helpful if the object type name can be printed with a variable in the template, too.
fields.summary: Print - template variable for object type name

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When creating Jira issues from Insight objects using the automation feature there is a limit of 255 characters on the 'Description' field. The Description field is a System Field within Jira and can hold 1000's of characters.Please increase the hard-coded character limit to something more reasonable (i.e. 10,000 chars).
fields.summary: Increase character limit on description field for automated Jira issues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great to be able to have some dynamic filter on a dashboard. Basically the same as the [Rich Filters for Jira Dashboards|[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214789/rich-filters-for-jira-dashboards]] but for Insight objects.  With this you will be able to handle a lot of data and create dynamic overview. In our example we are using Insight as CRM and CMDB system and we would be able to create customer-overviews on a single dashboard, instead of creating a dashboard for every customer. The same goes for the Confluence Macro, but I think this will be dependent on this one.
fields.summary: Provide rich filter for Dashboard

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,As Lansweeper is a well known hardware, sofwtare and user inventory, a dedicated Insight importer should be consider ...Regards,Pierre-Jean.
fields.summary: Consider a new integration : Lansweeper

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great to have some kind of organizational possibilities on the Detail view of an object. If you have a lot of attributes, it becomes quite confusing.A good example would be CRM as a use case. You have a lot of attributes sales is interested in, but a complete different set of attribues for the operations team. So having two tabs on the details view (like it is possible on the Jira issue view) would be great. Another solution could be to have different two or more expandable "details" groups.
fields.summary: Object Details - Organization/Tabs

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In my use case, objects (JSD organizations from the Jira database) are imported into a certain object type (Organization) regularly. Users should be able to edit certain attribute values of these objects. However, users should not be able to create new objects, because new objects (= newly added Organizations to the Service Desk) come from the scheduled import.To realize this, users need to have the Developers role to edit objects, but then they can also create objects. I only want them to be able to edit existing objects.Is this something you can realize in the Insight app?
fields.summary: Permission to edit existing objects, but not create new ones

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: So if i move a Object from Type A to Type B and the Attributes are different, i can only delete or find some hopefully fitting Attributes.What i would like to have is the History to show that the Object had some Attributes wich got deleted in a moving process. EG: Moving a PC to a Server Object-type and the assigned person gets lost, than it should print in the History.Attribute got deleted while moving: Assigned Person -> Peter With that there would always be a complete History of what the Object had.
fields.summary: Complete History, Old Attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi, We want to have a functionality to have the default watcher of an object, which can be defined in Object User type attribute. User will receive notifications about Object updates and interactions in tasks.Thank you!Anneta
fields.summary: Object default watcher

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great to have the possibility to specify a custom header when configuring the JSON import.We need to import data to Insight through a REST-API that requires us to have a custom parameter in the header.ExampleconsumerId: "myapp"
fields.summary: Custom header in JSON import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey,The world would be a better place if we could use our Insight Custom fields in Issue Security Schemes in JIRA.Use-case:We have our teams in Insight. Each object contains a Manager attribute and a Member attribute (0..n)We have sensitive tickets that is restricted to the team selected only (and a few other more static roles)Today we have a script that is run on create and update (only when the team field is updated) that grabs all users in the member attribute and add these to a regular User Picker Multi-Select field which in turn is added to the Issue Security Scheme. This works quite well but has one big caveat! When a new user is added to the team, i.e. the team attribute in Insight is updated this is  not automatically reflected in the ticket. We could either poke the Team field to re-run the script or run a maintenance job every night verifying all open tickets. Or have an update of the object trigger a change of all related tickets. None of these solutions scale very well and it would be smooother if the information in the Issue Security scheme can be in real-time.My suggestion is therefore to add Insight capability to the Issue Security Scheme to be able to use e.g. some form of dot-notation for Insight Custom fields like:*"My Team-field".Members*Wdyt? Awesome, right?Cheers,// Svante
fields.summary: Add Insight Custom Fields to Issue Security Schemes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,Instead of doing something like this to get all objects having a top parent by following a outbound Ref : object having outR(Name=10258) orobject having outR(object having outR(Name=10258)) orobject having outR(object having outR(object having outR(Name=10258))) orobject having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(Name=10258)))) orobject having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(Name=10258))))) orobject having outR( object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(Name=10258)))))) orobject having outR(object having outR( object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(object having outR(Name=10258))))))) ....Could be replace by somthing like "object having cascadingOutR(IQL, refTypes, depth)"Regards
fields.summary: Add an IQL function to search in a recursive way outbound references

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We're having a situation where we are using an external system for creating new objects. On this system, we set up the initial location of the object, and then objects are imported to Insight. We would like to be able to change the location of the object in Insight, but the issue is that the next import job will return the initial value of the location from the source.Another problem is that we are unable to update the location from the Insight to that system.I think that option "Existing objects", like you have "Missing objects", in import configuration would solve this issue.Idea is that we're able to define what we want to do with the existing objects in the schema. In this case, I would define if there is an object that matches a specific identifier and if it does - do nothing (don't update any attribute).
fields.summary: Import feature - "Existing objects"
